p: We compared the overall Minimum Infection Rate (MIR = 0.35), which was calculated based on all the seasons and specimens studied, with the MIR for Ae. albopictus only (MIR = 0.61) and the MIR for Ae. albopictus only from each season that had positive pools (MIR spring 2014 = 1.47; MIR autumn 2015 = 0.44). The MIR for spring 2014 was higher than for autumn 2015.
